project.name: OpenVeo Manage AngularJS back end
project.description: AngularJS OpenVeo Manage plugin back end documentation

ov.manage.name: ov.manage
ov.manage.description:
Defines components responsible of the manage plugin back end pages.

It creates two back end pages. One to display the list of devices and groups, the other
one to display the list of devices inside a group.

ManageDeviceFactory.name: ManageDeviceFactory
ManageDeviceFactory.description:
Defines a factory to manage devices.

Devices are categorized by state.
Either "accepted", "refused", "pending" or "incoming".
An "incoming" device is a newly connected device manifesting after retrieving
the list of known devices from the server.
A "pending" device is a connected device not in server's list of known devices.

ManageGroupFactory.name: ManageGroupFactory
ManageGroupFactory.description: Defines a factory to manage groups.

ManageFactory.name: ManageFactory
ManageFactory.description: Defines a factory to manage communications with the server.

ManageManageableController.name: ManageManageableController
ManageManageableController.description: Controls the view responsible of a list of manageables.

ManageManageableDetailController.name: ManageManageableDetailController
ManageManageableDetailController.description: Defines the manageable detail controller to manage view displaying details about a manageable.

ManageManageableFactory.name: ManageManageableFactory
ManageManageableFactory.description: Defines a factory to manage manageables.

ovManageSortTable.name: ovManageSortTable
ovManageSortTable.description: Creates a new Angular directive as an HTML attribute ov-manage-sort-table to be able to create a sort table.

classitems.description:
Retrieves a device by its id.

Search is made on all devices, accepted, pending, refused and incoming devices.

return.description: The device or null if not found

classitems.description:
Updates device's status message depending on its actual status.
Device's status message is a human readable explanation about the device's status.

classitems.description:
Checks if a schedule is not in collision with other schedules.

Device schedule should not be in collision with device's group schedules if inside the group.

return.description: The error if validation failed, null otherwise

classitems.description: Checks if there are collisions between device's schedules and group's schedules.
classitems.name: isGroupSchedulesCollision

return.description: true if there is at least one collision, false otherwise

classitems.description:
Gets a group by its id.

It implies that the list of groups has been retrieved
from server using GroupFactory.getGroups().

classitems.description:
Validates the selected manageable's inputs regarding the given preset id.

It is not possible to start a recording session if the inputs of the
selected manageable does not correspond to the preset configuration.
e.g. It is not possible to start a recording session with slides extraction
without a desktop input.
classitems.name: validatePreset

classitems.description:
Checks if two schedules are in conflict.

Conflict examples :

schedule1 : [------------]
schedule2 : [------------]

schedule1 : [------------]
schedule2 :              [------------]

schedule1 :              [------------]
schedule2 : [------------]

schedule1 : [------------]
schedule2 :   [------------]

schedule1 :   [------------]
schedule2 : [------------]

schedule1 : [------------]
schedule2 :   [--------]

schedule1 :   [--------]
schedule2 : [------------]
classitems.name: checkSchedulesConflict

props.name: beginDate
props.description: The begin date of the schedule

props.name: recurrent
props.description: true if this is a daily schedule, false otherwise

props.name: endDate
props.description: The end date of the daily schedule (required if recurrent is set to true)

props.name: beginDate
props.description: The begin date of the schedule

props.name: recurrent
props.description: true if this is a daily schedule, false otherwise

props.name: endDate
props.description: The end date of the daily schedule (required if recurrent is set to true)

return.description: true if there are in conflict, false otherwise
